newsitem.title: GERMANY: Germany must stick to EMU deficit goal - Kuehbacher.
newsitem.headline: Germany must stick to EMU deficit goal - Kuehbacher.

text.p: Germany must fulfill the Maastricht Treaty's criterion on public deficits for entry into European economic monetary union (EMU), Bundesbank council member Klaus-Dieter Kuehbacher said on Tuesday.
"Germany must fulfill the three percent (ratio of public deficit to gross domestic product) in 1997," Kuehbacher said in a debate on EMU held in Berlin.

Kuehbacher said an expected shortfall in 1997 tax revenues would make this goal more difficult but any failure by Germany to adhere to a strict interpretation of the Maastricht criteria would reduce confidence in the EMU project, he added.

Kuehbacher made no comment either on the revaluation of Bundesbank gold reserves that the German government is considering for budgetary purposes, or the possibility of increases in net public borrowing.
